image.description: container image to use for this node
image.markdownDescription: container [image](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#image) to use for this node

image-pull-policy.description: policy for pulling the referenced container image
image-pull-policy.markdownDescription: container [image-pull-policy](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#image-pull-policy) to use for this node

restart-policy.description: restart policy for the referenced container image
restart-policy.markdownDescription: container [restart-policy](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#restart-policy) to use for this node

type.description: type is a per-node property that can select a special type of a node

group.description: grouping parameter of a node. A free form string that is mainly used in sorting elements when graphing

startup-config.description: path to a startup config file (if supported by the kind)
startup-config.markdownDescription: path to a startup [config file](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#startup-config) (if supported by the kind)

enforce-startup-config.description: Set to `true` to make the node to boot with a startup-config even if the config file is present in the lab directory
enforce-startup-config.markdownDescription: Set to `true` to [make the node to boot with a startup-config](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#enforce-startup-config) even if the config file is present in the lab directory

suppress-startup-config.description: Set to `true` to prevent a startup-config file from being created (in a Zero-Touch Provisioning lab, for example)
suppress-startup-config.markdownDescription: Set to `true` to [prevent a startup-config file from being created](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#suppress-startup-config) By default, containerlab will create a startup-config when initially creating a lab.

auto-remove.description: Set to `true` to remove the node automatically, instead of auto-restarting
auto-remove.markdownDescription: Set to `true` to [remove the node/container automatically](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#auto-remove), instead of auto-restarting it

exec.description: list of commands to execute post deploy

user.description: user to use within the container

runtime.description: Runtime used to launch the container node

mgmt-ipv4.description: IPv4 management address of the node (e.g. 172.10.10.11)

mgmt-ipv6.description: IPv6 management address of the node (e.g. 172.10.10.11)

network-mode.description: node network mode (can only be set host, defaults to bridge)
network-mode.markdownDescription: node [network mode](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#network-mode) (can only be set host, defaults to bridge)

cpu.description: number of vcpu to allocate for this node/container

cpu-set.description: CPU cores to use by this node/container
cpu-set.markdownDescription: [CPU cores](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#cpu-set) to be used by the node/container

slot.description: Set component physical position on a distributed chassis

components.description: List of node components, used for multicontainer systems

aliases.description: list of additional network aliases for the node

shm-size.description: shared memory size limit allocated to the container. Supported memory suffixes (case insensitive): b, kib, kb, mib, mb, gib, gb
shm-size.markdownDescription: [shared memory size limit](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#shm-size) allocated to the container (e.g. 256MB). Supported memory suffixes (case insensitive): b, kib, kb, mib, mb, gib, gb

cap-add.description: list of capabilities to add to the container
cap-add.markdownDescription: list of [capabilities](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#cap-add) to add to the container

sysctls.description: sysctl kernel parameters to set in the container
sysctls.markdownDescription: [sysctl kernel parameters](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#sysctls) to set in the container

devices.description: list of host devices to add to the container
devices.markdownDescription: list of [host devices](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#devices) to add to the container

link-type-veth.description: Link definition to support the veth interfaces
link-type-veth.markdownDescription: Link definition to support the veth interfaces

link-type-mgmt-net.description: Link definition for management network interfaces

link-type-macvlan.description: Link definition describing a macvlan link endpoint configuration

link-endpoint.description: Common link endpoint object for extended link configs

link-vars.description: link-scoped variables used by config engine
link-vars.markdownDescription: link-scoped variables used by config engine

srl-agents.description: list of SR Linux agent's config files to be copied to the NOS filesystem
srl-agents.markdownDescription: list of [SR Linux agent's config files](https://containerlab.dev/manual/kinds/srl/#user-defined-custom-agents-for-sr-linux-nodes) to be copied to the NOS filesystem

mysocket-proxy.description: http/s proxy to be used by mysocketctl

vars.description: config variables passed to config engine
vars.markdownDescription: config variables passed to config engine

issue.description: Set to `true` to generate a TLS certificate for the node
issue.markdownDescription: Set to `true` to [generate a TLS certificate for the node](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#certificate)

sans.description: list of subject alternative names (SAN) to use for this node
sans.markdownDescription: list of [subject alternative names](https://containerlab.dev/manual/nodes/#subject-alternative-names) to use for this node

key-size.description: size of the to be generated key
key-size.markdownDescription: size of the to be generated key

validity-duration.description: Duration for how long the certificate issued by the CA will be valid.
validity-duration.markdownDescription: Duration for how long the certificate issued by the CA will be valid.

start-period.description: time in seconds to wait before starting the healthcheck

cert.description: Path to the CA certificate file. If set, it is expected that the CA certificate already exists by that path

key.description: Path to the CA key file. If set, it is expected that the CA certificate already exists by that path

key-size.description: Key size. Can only be set if the external CA certificate is not provided

validity-duration.description: CA certificate validity duration. Can only be set if the external CA certificate is not provided

oneOf.description: List of exec commands as objects, each containing `command`, `target`, and `phase`

phase.description: Phase to execute this command (on-enter or on-exit)

mtu.markdownDescription: [MTU](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#mtu) in Bytes for the custom management network

bridge.description: Set bridge to use for the management network (instead of the default generated bridge).
bridge.markdownDescription: Set [bridge](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#bridge-name) to use for the management network (instead of the default generated bridge).

ipv4-subnet.description: IPv4 subnet to use for the custom management network. e.g. 172.100.100.0/24
ipv4-subnet.markdownDescription: [IPv4 subnet](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#user-defined-addresses) to use for the custom management network. e.g. 172.100.100.0/24

ipv6-subnet.description: IPv6 subnet to use for the custom management network. e.g. 3fff:172:100:100::/64
ipv6-subnet.markdownDescription: [IPv6 subnet](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#user-defined-addresses) to be used for the custom management network. e.g. 3fff:172:100:100::/64

ipv4-gw.description: IPv4 gateway address that will be set on a bridge used for the management network. Will be set to the first available IP address by default
ipv4-gw.markdownDescription: IPv4 gateway address that will be set on a bridge used for the management network. Will be set to the first available IP address by default

ipv6-gw.description: IPv6 gateway address that will be set on a bridge used for the management network. Will be set to the first available IP address by default
ipv6-gw.markdownDescription: IPv6 gateway address that will be set on a bridge used for the management network. Will be set to the first available IP address by default

ipv4-range.description: IPv4 range out of the ipv4-subnet to use for the custom management network. e.g. 172.100.100.128/25
ipv4-range.markdownDescription: [IPv4 range](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#ip-range) out of the ipv4-subnet to use for the custom management network. e.g. 172.100.100.128/25

ipv6-range.description: IPv6 range out of the ipv6-subnet to use for the custom management network. e.g. 3fff:172:100:100:8000::/65
ipv6-range.markdownDescription: [IPv6 range](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#ip-range) out of the ipv6-subnet to use for the custom management network. e.g. 3fff:172:100:100:8000::/65

mtu.markdownDescription: [MTU](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#mtu) in Bytes for the custom management network

external-access.description: controls whether the management network has external access or not
external-access.markdownDescription: controls whether the [management network has external access](https://containerlab.dev/manual/network/#external-access) or not
